body_html:
@colesbury

/usr/include/c++/5/type_traits:119:12: internal compiler error: Segmentation fault when upgrading from master.

Have had this error before, resolved by rerunning compilation a few more times, but it's strange. This time running the install a few more times doesn't help, the compiler segfault happens every time at different files. Should the compiler be upgraded?

x86_64-linux-gnu-gcc --version
#x86_64-linux-gnu-gcc (Ubuntu 5.4.0-6ubuntu1~16.04.4) 5.4.0 20160609

lsb_release -a
#No LSB modules are available.
#Distributor ID: Ubuntu
#Description:    Ubuntu 16.04.1 LTS
#Release:        16.04
#Codename:       xenial

First install error:

In file included from /usr/include/c++/5/bits/move.h:57:0,
                 from /usr/include/c++/5/bits/stl_pair.h:59,
                 from /usr/include/c++/5/bits/stl_algobase.h:64,
                 from /usr/include/c++/5/vector:60,
                 from /home/mscho/vadim/.wigwam/src/pytorch/torch/csrc/generated/cuda_TensorShort.cpp:6:
/usr/include/c++/5/type_traits: In instantiation of ‘struct std::__or_<std::is_function<const at::Tensor&>, std::is_reference<const at::Tensor&>, std::is_void<const at::Tensor&> >’:
/usr/include/c++/5/type_traits:148:38:   required from ‘struct std::__not_<std::__or_<std::is_function<const at::Tensor&>, std::is_reference<const at::Tensor&>, std::is_void<const at::Tensor&> > >’
/usr/include/c++/5/type_traits:564:12:   required from ‘struct std::is_object<const at::Tensor&>’
/usr/include/c++/5/type_traits:114:12:   required from ‘struct std::__or_<std::is_object<const at::Tensor&>, std::is_reference<const at::Tensor&> >’
/usr/include/c++/5/type_traits:601:12:   required from ‘struct std::__is_referenceable<const at::Tensor&>’
/usr/include/c++/5/type_traits:1610:12:   [ skipping 2 instantiation contexts, use -ftemplate-backtrace-limit=0 to disable ]
/usr/include/c++/5/type_traits:1476:66:   required by substitution of ‘template<class _From1, class _To1, class> static std::true_type std::__is_convertible_helper<_From, _To, false>::__test(int) [with _From1 = const at::Tensor&; _To1 = at::Tensor; <template-parameter-1-3> = <missing>]’
/usr/include/c++/5/type_traits:1485:42:   required from ‘struct std::__is_convertible_helper<const at::Tensor&, at::Tensor, false>’
/usr/include/c++/5/type_traits:1491:12:   required from ‘struct std::is_convertible<const at::Tensor&, at::Tensor>’
/usr/include/c++/5/type_traits:137:12:   required from ‘struct std::__and_<std::is_convertible<const at::Tensor&, at::Tensor>, std::is_convertible<const at::Tensor&, at::Tensor> >’
/usr/include/c++/5/tuple:619:44:   required by substitution of ‘template<class _U1, class _U2, class> constexpr std::tuple<_T1, _T2>::tuple(const std::tuple<_U1, _U2>&) [with _U1 = at::Tensor; _U2 = at::Tensor; <template-parameter-1-3> = <missing>]’
/home/mscho/vadim/.wigwam/src/pytorch/torch/lib/tmp_install/include/ATen/Functions.h:823:51:   required from here
/usr/include/c++/5/type_traits:119:12: internal compiler error: Segmentation fault
     struct __or_<_B1, _B2, _B3, _Bn...>
            ^
Please submit a full bug report,
with preprocessed source if appropriate.
See <file:///usr/share/doc/gcc-5/README.Bugs> for instructions.

Second install error:

In file included from /home/mscho/vadim/.wigwam/src/pytorch/torch/csrc/generic/Tensor.cpp:1667:0,
                 from torch/csrc/generic/Tensor.cpp:1,
                 from /home/mscho/vadim/.wigwam/src/pytorch/torch/csrc/generated/TensorFloat.cpp:17:
/home/mscho/vadim/.wigwam/src/pytorch/torch/csrc/generic/TensorMethods.cpp: In function ‘PyObject* THPFloatTensor_stateless_pow(PyObject*, PyObject*, PyObject*)’:
/home/mscho/vadim/.wigwam/src/pytorch/torch/csrc/generic/TensorMethods.cpp:17671:1: internal compiler error: Segmentation fault
 }
 ^
Please submit a full bug report,
with preprocessed source if appropriate.
See <file:///usr/share/doc/gcc-5/README.Bugs> for instructions.
x86_64-linux-gnu-gcc -pthread -DNDEBUG -g -fwrapv -O2 -Wall -fno-strict-aliasing -Wdate-time -D_FORTIFY_SOURCE=2 -g -fstack-protector-strong -Wformat -Werror=format-security -fPIC -I/home/mscho/vadim/.wigwam/src/pytorch -I/home/mscho/vadim/.wigwam/src/pytorch/torch/csrc -I/home/mscho/vadim/.wigwam/src/pytorch/torch/lib/pybind11/include -I/home/mscho/vadim/.wigwam/src/pytorch/torch/lib/tmp_install/include -I/home/mscho/vadim/.wigwam/src/pytorch/torch/lib/tmp_install/include/TH -I/home/mscho/vadim/.wigwam/src/pytorch/torch/lib/tmp_install/include/THPP -I/home/mscho/vadim/.wigwam/src/pytorch/torch/lib/tmp_install/include/THNN -I/home/mscho/vadim/.wigwam/src/pytorch/torch/lib/tmp_install/include/ATen -I/home/mscho/vadim/.wigwam/prefix/python/lib/python2.7/site-packages/numpy/core/include -I/home/mscho/vadim/.wigwam/src/pytorch/torch/lib/tmp_install/include/THD -I/usr/local/cuda/include -I/home/mscho/vadim/.wigwam/src/pytorch/torch/lib/tmp_install/include/THCUNN -I/usr/include/python2.7 -c /home/mscho/vadim/.wigwam/src/pytorch/torch/csrc/generated/TensorChar.cpp -o build/temp.linux-x86_64-2.7/home/mscho/vadim/.wigwam/src/pytorch/torch/csrc/generated/TensorChar.o -D_THP_CORE -std=c++11 -Wno-write-strings -fno-strict-aliasing -Wno-missing-braces -DWITH_NUMPY -DWITH_DISTRIBUTED -DWITH_CUDA -DCUDA_LIB_PATH=/usr/local/cuda/lib64 -DWITH_NCCL
error: command 'x86_64-linux-gnu-gcc' failed with exit status 1
In file included from /home/mscho/vadim/.wigwam/src/pytorch/torch/lib/tmp_install/include/TH/TH.h:4:0,
                 from /home/mscho/vadim/.wigwam/src/pytorch/torch/csrc/cuda/THCP.h:5,
                 from /home/mscho/vadim/.wigwam/src/pytorch/torch/csrc/generated/cuda_TensorShort.cpp:9:
/home/mscho/vadim/.wigwam/src/pytorch/torch/csrc/generic/Tensor.cpp: In function ‘void THCPShortTensor_initCopyMethods()’:
/home/mscho/vadim/.wigwam/src/pytorch/torch/csrc/cuda/override_macros.h:20:38: internal compiler error: Segmentation fault
 #define THPTensor_(NAME) TH_CONCAT_4(THCP,Real,Tensor_,NAME)
                                      ^
/home/mscho/vadim/.wigwam/src/pytorch/torch/lib/tmp_install/include/TH/THGeneral.h:118:37: note: in definition of macro ‘TH_CONCAT_4_EXPAND’
 #define TH_CONCAT_4_EXPAND(x,y,z,w) x ## y ## z ## w
                                     ^
/home/mscho/vadim/.wigwam/src/pytorch/torch/csrc/cuda/override_macros.h:20:26: note: in expansion of macro ‘TH_CONCAT_4’
 #define THPTensor_(NAME) TH_CONCAT_4(THCP,Real,Tensor_,NAME)
                          ^
/home/mscho/vadim/.wigwam/src/pytorch/torch/csrc/generic/Tensor.cpp:1779:6: note: in expansion of macro ‘THPTensor_’
 void THPTensor_(initCopyMethods)()
      ^
Please submit a full bug report,
with preprocessed source if appropriate.
See <file:///usr/share/doc/gcc-5/README.Bugs> for instructions.
body_text:
@colesbury
/usr/include/c++/5/type_traits:119:12: internal compiler error: Segmentation fault when upgrading from master.
Have had this error before, resolved by rerunning compilation a few more times, but it's strange. This time running the install a few more times doesn't help, the compiler segfault happens every time at different files. Should the compiler be upgraded?
x86_64-linux-gnu-gcc --version
#x86_64-linux-gnu-gcc (Ubuntu 5.4.0-6ubuntu1~16.04.4) 5.4.0 20160609

lsb_release -a
#No LSB modules are available.
#Distributor ID: Ubuntu
#Description:    Ubuntu 16.04.1 LTS
#Release:        16.04
#Codename:       xenial
First install error:
In file included from /usr/include/c++/5/bits/move.h:57:0,
                 from /usr/include/c++/5/bits/stl_pair.h:59,
                 from /usr/include/c++/5/bits/stl_algobase.h:64,
                 from /usr/include/c++/5/vector:60,
                 from /home/mscho/vadim/.wigwam/src/pytorch/torch/csrc/generated/cuda_TensorShort.cpp:6:
/usr/include/c++/5/type_traits: In instantiation of ‘struct std::__or_<std::is_function<const at::Tensor&>, std::is_reference<const at::Tensor&>, std::is_void<const at::Tensor&> >’:
/usr/include/c++/5/type_traits:148:38:   required from ‘struct std::__not_<std::__or_<std::is_function<const at::Tensor&>, std::is_reference<const at::Tensor&>, std::is_void<const at::Tensor&> > >’

/usr/include/c++/5/type_traits:114:12:   required from ‘struct std::__or_<std::is_object<const at::Tensor&>, std::is_reference<const at::Tensor&> >’
/usr/include/c++/5/type_traits:601:12:   required from ‘struct std::__is_referenceable<const at::Tensor&>’
/usr/include/c++/5/type_traits:1610:12:   [ skipping 2 instantiation contexts, use -ftemplate-backtrace-limit=0 to disable ]
/usr/include/c++/5/type_traits:1476:66:   required by substitution of ‘template<class _From1, class _To1, class> static std::true_type std::__is_convertible_helper<_From, _To, false>::__test(int) [with _From1 = const at::Tensor&; _To1 = at::Tensor; <template-parameter-1-3> = <missing>]’
/usr/include/c++/5/type_traits:1485:42:   required from ‘struct std::__is_convertible_helper<const at::Tensor&, at::Tensor, false>’
/usr/include/c++/5/type_traits:1491:12:   required from ‘struct std::is_convertible<const at::Tensor&, at::Tensor>’
/usr/include/c++/5/type_traits:137:12:   required from ‘struct std::__and_<std::is_convertible<const at::Tensor&, at::Tensor>, std::is_convertible<const at::Tensor&, at::Tensor> >’
/usr/include/c++/5/tuple:619:44:   required by substitution of ‘template<class _U1, class _U2, class> constexpr std::tuple<_T1, _T2>::tuple(const std::tuple<_U1, _U2>&) [with _U1 = at::Tensor; _U2 = at::Tensor; <template-parameter-1-3> = <missing>]’
/home/mscho/vadim/.wigwam/src/pytorch/torch/lib/tmp_install/include/ATen/Functions.h:823:51:   required from here
/usr/include/c++/5/type_traits:119:12: internal compiler error: Segmentation fault

            ^
Please submit a full bug report,
with preprocessed source if appropriate.
See <file:///usr/share/doc/gcc-5/README.Bugs> for instructions.

Second install error:
In file included from /home/mscho/vadim/.wigwam/src/pytorch/torch/csrc/generic/Tensor.cpp:1667:0,
                 from torch/csrc/generic/Tensor.cpp:1,
                 from /home/mscho/vadim/.wigwam/src/pytorch/torch/csrc/generated/TensorFloat.cpp:17:
/home/mscho/vadim/.wigwam/src/pytorch/torch/csrc/generic/TensorMethods.cpp: In function ‘PyObject* THPFloatTensor_stateless_pow(PyObject*, PyObject*, PyObject*)’:
/home/mscho/vadim/.wigwam/src/pytorch/torch/csrc/generic/TensorMethods.cpp:17671:1: internal compiler error: Segmentation fault
 }
 ^
Please submit a full bug report,
with preprocessed source if appropriate.
See <file:///usr/share/doc/gcc-5/README.Bugs> for instructions.
x86_64-linux-gnu-gcc -pthread -DNDEBUG -g -fwrapv -O2 -Wall -fno-strict-aliasing -Wdate-time -D_FORTIFY_SOURCE=2 -g -fstack-protector-strong -Wformat -Werror=format-security -fPIC -I/home/mscho/vadim/.wigwam/src/pytorch -I/home/mscho/vadim/.wigwam/src/pytorch/torch/csrc -I/home/mscho/vadim/.wigwam/src/pytorch/torch/lib/pybind11/include -I/home/mscho/vadim/.wigwam/src/pytorch/torch/lib/tmp_install/include -I/home/mscho/vadim/.wigwam/src/pytorch/torch/lib/tmp_install/include/TH -I/home/mscho/vadim/.wigwam/src/pytorch/torch/lib/tmp_install/include/THPP -I/home/mscho/vadim/.wigwam/src/pytorch/torch/lib/tmp_install/include/THNN -I/home/mscho/vadim/.wigwam/src/pytorch/torch/lib/tmp_install/include/ATen -I/home/mscho/vadim/.wigwam/prefix/python/lib/python2.7/site-packages/numpy/core/include -I/home/mscho/vadim/.wigwam/src/pytorch/torch/lib/tmp_install/include/THD -I/usr/local/cuda/include -I/home/mscho/vadim/.wigwam/src/pytorch/torch/lib/tmp_install/include/THCUNN -I/usr/include/python2.7 -c /home/mscho/vadim/.wigwam/src/pytorch/torch/csrc/generated/TensorChar.cpp -o build/temp.linux-x86_64-2.7/home/mscho/vadim/.wigwam/src/pytorch/torch/csrc/generated/TensorChar.o -D_THP_CORE -std=c++11 -Wno-write-strings -fno-strict-aliasing -Wno-missing-braces -DWITH_NUMPY -DWITH_DISTRIBUTED -DWITH_CUDA -DCUDA_LIB_PATH=/usr/local/cuda/lib64 -DWITH_NCCL
error: command 'x86_64-linux-gnu-gcc' failed with exit status 1
In file included from /home/mscho/vadim/.wigwam/src/pytorch/torch/lib/tmp_install/include/TH/TH.h:4:0,
                 from /home/mscho/vadim/.wigwam/src/pytorch/torch/csrc/cuda/THCP.h:5,
                 from /home/mscho/vadim/.wigwam/src/pytorch/torch/csrc/generated/cuda_TensorShort.cpp:9:
/home/mscho/vadim/.wigwam/src/pytorch/torch/csrc/generic/Tensor.cpp: In function ‘void THCPShortTensor_initCopyMethods()’:

with preprocessed source if appropriate.

body:
@colesbury 

`/usr/include/c++/5/type_traits:119:12: internal compiler error: Segmentation fault` when upgrading from master.

Have had this error before, resolved by rerunning compilation a few more times, but it's strange. This time running the install a few more times doesn't help, the compiler segfault happens every time at different files. Should the compiler be upgraded?

```shell
x86_64-linux-gnu-gcc --version
#x86_64-linux-gnu-gcc (Ubuntu 5.4.0-6ubuntu1~16.04.4) 5.4.0 20160609

lsb_release -a
#No LSB modules are available.
#Distributor ID: Ubuntu
#Description:    Ubuntu 16.04.1 LTS
#Release:        16.04
#Codename:       xenial
```

First install error:
```
In file included from /usr/include/c++/5/bits/move.h:57:0,
                 from /usr/include/c++/5/bits/stl_pair.h:59,
                 from /usr/include/c++/5/bits/stl_algobase.h:64,
                 from /usr/include/c++/5/vector:60,
                 from /home/mscho/vadim/.wigwam/src/pytorch/torch/csrc/generated/cuda_TensorShort.cpp:6:
/usr/include/c++/5/type_traits: In instantiation of ‘struct std::__or_<std::is_function<const at::Tensor&>, std::is_reference<const at::Tensor&>, std::is_void<const at::Tensor&> >’:
/usr/include/c++/5/type_traits:148:38:   required from ‘struct std::__not_<std::__or_<std::is_function<const at::Tensor&>, std::is_reference<const at::Tensor&>, std::is_void<const at::Tensor&> > >’
/usr/include/c++/5/type_traits:564:12:   required from ‘struct std::is_object<const at::Tensor&>’
/usr/include/c++/5/type_traits:114:12:   required from ‘struct std::__or_<std::is_object<const at::Tensor&>, std::is_reference<const at::Tensor&> >’
/usr/include/c++/5/type_traits:601:12:   required from ‘struct std::__is_referenceable<const at::Tensor&>’
/usr/include/c++/5/type_traits:1610:12:   [ skipping 2 instantiation contexts, use -ftemplate-backtrace-limit=0 to disable ]
/usr/include/c++/5/type_traits:1476:66:   required by substitution of ‘template<class _From1, class _To1, class> static std::true_type std::__is_convertible_helper<_From, _To, false>::__test(int) [with _From1 = const at::Tensor&; _To1 = at::Tensor; <template-parameter-1-3> = <missing>]’
/usr/include/c++/5/type_traits:1485:42:   required from ‘struct std::__is_convertible_helper<const at::Tensor&, at::Tensor, false>’
/usr/include/c++/5/type_traits:1491:12:   required from ‘struct std::is_convertible<const at::Tensor&, at::Tensor>’
/usr/include/c++/5/type_traits:137:12:   required from ‘struct std::__and_<std::is_convertible<const at::Tensor&, at::Tensor>, std::is_convertible<const at::Tensor&, at::Tensor> >’
/usr/include/c++/5/tuple:619:44:   required by substitution of ‘template<class _U1, class _U2, class> constexpr std::tuple<_T1, _T2>::tuple(const std::tuple<_U1, _U2>&) [with _U1 = at::Tensor; _U2 = at::Tensor; <template-parameter-1-3> = <missing>]’
/home/mscho/vadim/.wigwam/src/pytorch/torch/lib/tmp_install/include/ATen/Functions.h:823:51:   required from here
/usr/include/c++/5/type_traits:119:12: internal compiler error: Segmentation fault
     struct __or_<_B1, _B2, _B3, _Bn...>
            ^
Please submit a full bug report,
with preprocessed source if appropriate.
See <file:///usr/share/doc/gcc-5/README.Bugs> for instructions.
```

Second install error:
```
In file included from /home/mscho/vadim/.wigwam/src/pytorch/torch/csrc/generic/Tensor.cpp:1667:0,
                 from torch/csrc/generic/Tensor.cpp:1,
                 from /home/mscho/vadim/.wigwam/src/pytorch/torch/csrc/generated/TensorFloat.cpp:17:
/home/mscho/vadim/.wigwam/src/pytorch/torch/csrc/generic/TensorMethods.cpp: In function ‘PyObject* THPFloatTensor_stateless_pow(PyObject*, PyObject*, PyObject*)’:
/home/mscho/vadim/.wigwam/src/pytorch/torch/csrc/generic/TensorMethods.cpp:17671:1: internal compiler error: Segmentation fault
 }
 ^
Please submit a full bug report,
with preprocessed source if appropriate.
See <file:///usr/share/doc/gcc-5/README.Bugs> for instructions.
x86_64-linux-gnu-gcc -pthread -DNDEBUG -g -fwrapv -O2 -Wall -fno-strict-aliasing -Wdate-time -D_FORTIFY_SOURCE=2 -g -fstack-protector-strong -Wformat -Werror=format-security -fPIC -I/home/mscho/vadim/.wigwam/src/pytorch -I/home/mscho/vadim/.wigwam/src/pytorch/torch/csrc -I/home/mscho/vadim/.wigwam/src/pytorch/torch/lib/pybind11/include -I/home/mscho/vadim/.wigwam/src/pytorch/torch/lib/tmp_install/include -I/home/mscho/vadim/.wigwam/src/pytorch/torch/lib/tmp_install/include/TH -I/home/mscho/vadim/.wigwam/src/pytorch/torch/lib/tmp_install/include/THPP -I/home/mscho/vadim/.wigwam/src/pytorch/torch/lib/tmp_install/include/THNN -I/home/mscho/vadim/.wigwam/src/pytorch/torch/lib/tmp_install/include/ATen -I/home/mscho/vadim/.wigwam/prefix/python/lib/python2.7/site-packages/numpy/core/include -I/home/mscho/vadim/.wigwam/src/pytorch/torch/lib/tmp_install/include/THD -I/usr/local/cuda/include -I/home/mscho/vadim/.wigwam/src/pytorch/torch/lib/tmp_install/include/THCUNN -I/usr/include/python2.7 -c /home/mscho/vadim/.wigwam/src/pytorch/torch/csrc/generated/TensorChar.cpp -o build/temp.linux-x86_64-2.7/home/mscho/vadim/.wigwam/src/pytorch/torch/csrc/generated/TensorChar.o -D_THP_CORE -std=c++11 -Wno-write-strings -fno-strict-aliasing -Wno-missing-braces -DWITH_NUMPY -DWITH_DISTRIBUTED -DWITH_CUDA -DCUDA_LIB_PATH=/usr/local/cuda/lib64 -DWITH_NCCL
error: command 'x86_64-linux-gnu-gcc' failed with exit status 1
In file included from /home/mscho/vadim/.wigwam/src/pytorch/torch/lib/tmp_install/include/TH/TH.h:4:0,
                 from /home/mscho/vadim/.wigwam/src/pytorch/torch/csrc/cuda/THCP.h:5,
                 from /home/mscho/vadim/.wigwam/src/pytorch/torch/csrc/generated/cuda_TensorShort.cpp:9:
/home/mscho/vadim/.wigwam/src/pytorch/torch/csrc/generic/Tensor.cpp: In function ‘void THCPShortTensor_initCopyMethods()’:
/home/mscho/vadim/.wigwam/src/pytorch/torch/csrc/cuda/override_macros.h:20:38: internal compiler error: Segmentation fault
 #define THPTensor_(NAME) TH_CONCAT_4(THCP,Real,Tensor_,NAME)
                                      ^
/home/mscho/vadim/.wigwam/src/pytorch/torch/lib/tmp_install/include/TH/THGeneral.h:118:37: note: in definition of macro ‘TH_CONCAT_4_EXPAND’
 #define TH_CONCAT_4_EXPAND(x,y,z,w) x ## y ## z ## w
                                     ^
/home/mscho/vadim/.wigwam/src/pytorch/torch/csrc/cuda/override_macros.h:20:26: note: in expansion of macro ‘TH_CONCAT_4’
 #define THPTensor_(NAME) TH_CONCAT_4(THCP,Real,Tensor_,NAME)
                          ^
/home/mscho/vadim/.wigwam/src/pytorch/torch/csrc/generic/Tensor.cpp:1779:6: note: in expansion of macro ‘THPTensor_’
 void THPTensor_(initCopyMethods)()
      ^
Please submit a full bug report,
with preprocessed source if appropriate.
See <file:///usr/share/doc/gcc-5/README.Bugs> for instructions.
```
